	by jmason.org (Postfix) with ESMTP id ED54916F03

	by localhost with IMAP (fetchmail-5.9.0)
	for jm@localhost (single-drop); Sun, 22 Sep 2002 14:34:12 +0100 (IST)

    [216.136.171.252]) by dogma.slashnull.org (8.11.6/8.11.6) with ESMTP id
    g8MDQnC03193 for <jm-razor@jmason.org>; Sun, 22 Sep 2002 14:26:49 +0100

    22 Sep 2002 06:19:05 -0700

    22 Sep 2002 06:18:15 -0700

    17t6co-0000Gx-00 for razor-users@lists.sourceforge.net; Sun,
    22 Sep 2002 06:18:14 -0700

Message-Id: <1032700747.1536.5.camel@phoebe.mandris.com>

Subject: [Razor-users] Forged email address

X-Mailman-Version: 2.0.9-sf.net
Precedence: bulk
List-Help: <mailto:razor-users-request@example.sourceforge.net?subject=help>
List-Post: <mailto:razor-users@example.sourceforge.net>
List-Subscribe: <https://example.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/razor-users>,
    <mailto:razor-users-request@lists.sourceforge.net?subject=subscribe>
List-Id: <razor-users.example.sourceforge.net>
List-Unsubscribe: <https://example.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/razor-users>,
    <mailto:razor-users-request@lists.sourceforge.net?subject=unsubscribe>
List-Archive: <http://sourceforge.net/mailarchives/forum.php?forum=razor-users>
X-Original-Date: 22 Sep 2002 08:18:55 -0500
Date: 22 Sep 2002 08:18:55 -0500

I received a spam email that had apparently forged the From header with
my own email address. After reviewing the message I forwarded it with
the rest of a batch of spam ti the database with razor-report. Now of,
course, my own email address is listed int he Razor database. How do I
go about getting it removed.

I have seen this ploy (forged From headers) several time since then.
Perhaps the razor-report need to detect this and emit a warning.

dave
